prompt: While some websites discourage poor behavior by identifying users by their real names, other websites discourage poor behavior through community feedback or cancelling the accounts of misbehaving users. What is one benefit of allowing anonymity, but punishing misbehaving users?
feedback: One of the benefits of maintaining anonymity on a website is that it allow users to feel more comfortable talking about controversial or embarrassing issues. That’s one of the good aspects of anonymity. Anonymity doesn’t really allow people to be held personally responsible for what they do, since their names and identities are hidden, and although anonymity allows users to be mean or critical, this isn’t a benefit.
